creditline: Anonymous gift in honor of Gordon Brodfuehrer
description: village buildings in blue and black along bottom, with watchtower at center; pink and red sky across top, with dark blue slashes throughout
signed: LL in orange paint: T. Ono | verso, center in black: [Japanese script] Tadashige Ono
text: With crisscrossing lines, Ono depicted rice fields fringed by dwellings and a watch tower under a brooding sky. During the 1920s and 1930s, he made expressionistic prints representing the plight of Japan’s working classes. For his leftist views, Ono was barred from participating in exhibitions but nonetheless won acclaim for his arresting compositions.
title: Fishing Village
